title: A Randomized Open-Label, Placebo-Controlled Multi-Center Study of CAD-101 (monoclonal antibody) in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
officialTitle: A Randomized Open-Label, Placebo-Controlled Multi-Center Study of CAD-101 (monoclonal antibody) in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
sponsor: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description: This is a randomized open-label, placebo-controlled multi-center study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CAD-101 (monoclonal antibody) in patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis. The study will enroll approximately 347 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 21-65 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Rheumatoid Arthritis
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Active disease defined by standard criteria
- Inadequate response to conventional therapy
- Positive serology (if applicable)

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
- Active infection including tuberculosis
- History of recurrent serious infections
- Concurrent autoimmune disease other than study indication
